text:
Here is a patch to incorporate soapui's  (http://soapui.org) ability to generate
a template request for a given SOAP operation.  This patches two files:

src/core/org/apache/jmeter/resources/messages.properties
src/protocol/http/org/apache/jmeter/protocol/http/control/gui/SoapSamplerGui.java

Also included is a jar file that is a "wrapper" around the soapui calls.  This
is so that you can compile jmeter without having to include all the soapui jars.
creator: shahs@yahoo-inc.com

text:
Created attachment 19518
patch for jmeter src

text:
FYI these patches apply cleanly to both the rel-2-1 and rel-2-2 branches of the
code.
creator: shahs@yahoo-inc.com

text:
JMeter must be able to run on Java 1.4 - is it possible to compile the 
wrappers and add-ons using 1.4?

Also, will JMeter then run without the soapui jars?
creator: sebb@apache.org
shahs@yahoo-inc.com
text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> JMeter must be able to run on Java 1.4 - is it possible to compile the 
> wrappers and add-ons using 1.4?

Yes, I checked that the patches compile cleanly under 1.4.  JMeter will continue
to run under 1.4.  However if you want to use the soapUI functionality then you
will need 1.5 or higher.  I will update the attachments with a jar compiled with
-source 1.4 and -target 1.4 as well as the source with the modified build.xml


> 
> Also, will JMeter then run without the soapui jars?

Yes JMeter will run without the jars, this patch simply adds functionality to
help generate a request.  It does not save anything extra to the jmx file or
make any calls after a test is started.

Thanks!

Created attachment 19521
updated src to include target and source of 1.4
creator: shahs@yahoo-inc.com

shahs@yahoo-inc.com
text:
Created attachment 19530
updated (cleaned up) patch for jmeter src

Created attachment 28464
Updated patch to r1293562

Hello,
I updated patch and also classes that bridge SOAP UI.

This patch can ease Soap methods testing since SOAP-UI generates really good templates.
Bridge has Compilation dependency on SOAP UI so I don't think it can be included in JMeter but other classes work without it.

Implementation of bridge must implement org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.control.gui.WSDLToSoapRequestGenerator
and implementation is configured in jmeter.properties:
-soap_request_generator

So it could be anything, not just SOAP UI.

Testing it patch seems useful to me.

I can host the bridge code somewhere if it cannot be included in JMeter.

Should I commit it ?
Thanks 
Regards
Philippe
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
milamber@apache.org
text:
Hello,

SOAP/XML-RPC Request is an old sampler for Webservice in my opinion, WebService(SOAP) Request seems better and brings several functionality for message. (but no to generate dynamically the soap message)

In your patch missing the messages.properties update, and sometimes there aren't the space before the left parenthesis of if statement (i.e. "  if(var... " )

Soapui's license is LGPL 2.1 thus the generator cannot be include in JMeter.
http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-x
An external hosting for the generator (www.apache-extras.org ? [1]) seems a solution

Milamber



[1] http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/www-announce/201012.mbox/%3C685955.6439.qm%40web30802.mail.mud.yahoo.com%3E

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello,
IN my opinion SOAP/XML-RPC Request has still its place and I think has better performances than Webservice Sampler because the latter uses DOM and XML Parsing while SOAP/XML-RPC Request just sends the raw request so performs better in terms of memory and CPU.
And Webservice Sampler had other issues that I fixed this afternoon.

But I agree this feature could also be plugged in Webservice Sampler where it is partly implemented as Soap operations are extracted.

I propose to rework the patch to plug it into the 2 samplers.


Regards
Philippe

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
After some more thoughts, I think this is too much work regarding what it brings, it introduces:
- Licensing issues 
- Dependencies hard to manage (if for example generator relies on Soap UI)
- Pluggability with Soap UI is not great as proposed, Soap UI threads still live after generation and init is slow.
- Setup instructions

And I think it is easier to use Soap UI to generate XML and then copy paste in JMeter text box
